question: Which nation houses "Dja Faunal Reserve"?
explanation: Dja Faunal Reserve is located in Cameroon. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is one of the largest and best-protected rainforests in Africa. Almost 90 per cent of the reserve's area is left undisturbed. It is surrounded by the Dja River. This reserve forms a part of Congo Basin. This reserve is famous for the population of Baka pygmies, western lowland gorilla, chimpanzee and forest elephants.
